newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: INSIGHT-DUTCH CHARTISTS BROADLY UPBEAT ON AEX.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT-DUTCH CHARTISTS BROADLY UPBEAT ON AEX.

text.p: Dutch chartists were broadly
upbeat on this week's outlook for the AEX share index on Monday,
with many predicting a short-term rally.
ING Barings said its saw further confirmation of the bullish
chart picture, while money flow indicators signalled buyers
coming back to the market.
Mees Pierson and JAAD both said technical indicators were
improving, while ABN AMRO noted that the index had finally
broken the resistance level at around 740 and advised investors
to increase their long positions.
The AEX share index closed at 741.79 points last Friday,
17.41 points up from the previous week's close.
Contributor Trend Pvs view Support Resistance
First Second First Second
ABN AMRO Up Up 740 730 745 755
JAAD Up Neutral 582 571 774 801
ING Barings Up Neutral 725 730 770 780
MeesPierson Neutral Neutral 698 685 742 779
Rabo Sec. Neutral Neutral 712 698 744 769
Note - Contributors' own analysis follows.
ABN AMRO - Amsterdam has finally broken the resistance level
around 740, after testing it twice. today we saw a test of these
levels during opening hours, which decreased the downward
potential on the short time frame considerably. So we advise to
increase you LONG positions at current levels for a ride with
the Bulls towards the previous tops at 780. Intermediate
resistance levels are present around 745 and 755, however, they
are of little significance.
A broad range of individual stocks show a comparable
outlook, which supports our view.
Additionally, related interest rate futures and important
currencies are still supporting the upward scenario. In short,
strong upward potential is still present at current levels.
Consequently our short term indicators have bottomed out as
higher prices are being set.
ING BARINGS - The AEX is slowly completing large base
formation on the upside. The bullish picture on the charts of
the AEX has been confirmed by a golden cross of the two
short-term moving averages, with both averages on an upward
slope. Intermediate objectives come in around 770, then at
crucial resistance at 780.
A solid break above 780 is required to have the long-term
uptrend resumed. Money flow of the AEX is slowly picking up
again, confirming buying power in the market. It also indicates
improving technicals. Money flow indicators signal buyers
rushing back into the market.
The A/D ratio remains a bit subdued, signalling lack of
leadership. All in all we conclude that the underlying
technicals have further improved over the past few days.
The medium term patterns of the AEX, as well as the short
term trend, both showing rising slopes, are bullish.
JAAD - Most indicators have turned Positive so the programme
has given a buying signal. It could well be that the market has
reached its turning point.
RABO SECURITIES - For the third week in succession we have
to report that the trading range is still intact. Last Friday
the AEX once again tested resistance at 745 and bounced back.
Technical indicators are confirming this neutral picture.
However, a clear break on either side of this trading range
would fuel a new rally. We expect the market to remain volatile
for the coming weeks but we do not think that support at 698
will give way easily.
Due to the fact that the resistance at 745 is tested once
more, this barrier is getting stronger and a possible break of
this level will be more significant.
MEES PIERSON - The short-term technical indicators are
improving. The cue may come again from Wall Street this week
which last week rose a hefty 300 points but is still in a
downtrend in the upper side of the trend, testing resistance.
The market stays capped in a trading range between roughly
698 and 742. We still think the risks are on the downside here
the market could reach the level of 680 or 660.
Therefore we first need to see a break from the support at
698. If the market is going to break the 742 level we can expect
a very fast test of the old top at 779.
The long-term uptrend is still intact.
-- Amsterdam newsroom +31 20 504 5000, Fax +31 20 504 5040
